Sentences: この問題について，みなで考えようではありませんか。
Translate: Let's think about this issue together.

Sentences: 一人一人がごみを減らす努力をしようではないか。
Translate: Let each one of us make an effort to reduce waste.

Sentences: 目標に向かってお互いがんばろうじゃないか!
Translate: Let's do our best to reach our goals!

Sentences: やりつけないことをして疲れた。
Translate: I'm tired of doing things I can't do.

Sentences: 母の苦労を見るにつけ、子ども心に胸が痛んだ。
Translate: As I watched my mother's hardship, my heart ached like a child's.

Sentences: 官僚の汚職事件を見るにつけ聞くにつけ腹が立つ。
Translate: The more I saw and heard about bureaucratic corruption cases, the angrier I got.

Sentences: 試験での失敗を思い出すにつけ、悔しさがよみがえる。
Translate: The more I remembered my failures in exams, the more I felt frustrated.

Sentences: 本を読むにつけ、文章を書くにつけ，辞書は必需品だ。
Translate: A dictionary is a necessity for reading and writing.

Sentences: 松田選手は試合の結果がいいにつけ悪いにつけ、そのビデオを見て研究しているそうだ。
Translate: I heard that Matsuda watches and studies the videos of his matches, whether the results are good or bad.

Sentences: うれしいにつけ悲しいにつけ、私は母に手紙を書いた。
Translate: Happy or sad, I wrote a letter to my mother.

Sentences: 怠け者の彼は雨につけ風につけ学校を休みたがる。
Translate: He was lazy and wanted to miss school because of the rain and wind.

Sentences: 私は雨女で、子どものころ、遠足と言うといつも雨が降ったものだ。
Translate: I am a rain woman, and when I was a child, it always rained on our field trips.

Sentences: 父は野球が大好きで、シーズン中はテレビと言えば野球中継ばかりだ。
Translate: My father loved baseball, and during the season, the only thing on TV was the baseball games.

Sentences: 恋人と別れたときの寂しさといったら、泣きたいぐらいだった。
Translate: When he broke up with his girlfriend, he was so sad that he wanted to cry.

Sentences: その時の彼の顔といったら、幽霊でも見たかのように真っ青だった。
Translate: His face at that time was so pale that it looked like he had seen a ghost.

Sentences: なぜこの大学を選んだかというと、学習環境が整っているからです。
Translate: The reason why I chose this university was because of its excellent learning environment.

Sentences: 日本では花と言えば桜だ。
Translate: In Japan, the word for flower is cherry blossoms.

Sentences: 東京で若者の街と言ったら、そりゃあ渋谷に原宿だろう。
Translate: In Tokyo, the streets for young people are probably Shibuya and Harajuku.

Sentences: 日本料理というと、まずてんぷらやすしが思い浮かぶ。
Translate: When I think of Japanese cuisine, the first things that come to mind are tempura and sushi.

Sentences: そう言えば、朝から顔色が悪かったですね。
Translate: Speaking of which, you were looking a little pale this morning.

Sentences: 発音が悪いといえば、私も昔、こんな失敗がありましたよ。
Translate: Speaking of bad pronunciation, I also made this mistake a long time ago.

Sentences: 山田先生といえば、今度本を出版なさるそうだよ。
Translate: Speaking of Dr. Yamada, I heard that she is going to publish a book.

Sentences: 父は禁煙すると言いつつたばこを吸い続けている。
Translate: My father says he is going to quit smoking, but he continues to smoke.

Sentences: 頭では「行かなければ」と考えつつも、体が動かなかった。
Translate: In my head, I was thinking that I had to go, but my body was not moving.

Sentences: 彼女の話をうそと知りつつ、お金を貸してあげた。
Translate: I knew her story was a lie, but I lent her some money.

Sentences: 私は利益を追求しつつ社会貢献もする、そういう会社をつくりたいと思います。
Translate: I would like to create such a company that pursues profit but also contributes to society.

Sentences: 彼は公務員として働きつつ小説を書きつづけ、ついに有名な賞を受賞した。
Translate: While working as a civil servant, he continued to write novels and finally won a famous prize.

Sentences: 父は娘の花嫁姿を眺めつつ、彼女が生まれた日のことを思い出していた。
Translate: The father was looking at his daughter's bridal gown and remembering the day she was born.

Sentences: 新たな証拠が出てきた以上、彼女が犯人だと断定せざるを得ない。
Translate: Now that new evidence has come to light, he has no choice but to conclude that she is the murderer.

Sentences: 今年は仕事が忙しいので、夏休みの海外旅行はあきらめざるを得ない。
Translate: I'm busy with work this year, so I'll have to give up my summer vacation trip abroad.

Sentences: 未経験者だけで冬山に登るなど、無謀といわざるを得ない。
Translate: Climbing a winter mountain with only inexperienced climbers is reckless, I must say.

Sentences: 学校の規則なので、髪を切らざるを得ない。
Translate: I have to cut my hair because of school regulations.

Sentences: 夫がたばこをやめたのは、妊娠した妻のためにほかならない。
Translate: The husband quit smoking for nothing but his pregnant wife.

Sentences: 脳死は人間の死にほかならないと考える人が増えた。
Translate: More and more people believe that brain death is nothing more than the death of a human being.

Sentences: 新しい事業の成功は、社員全員の努力の賜物にほかならない。
Translate: The success of a new business is nothing but the result of the efforts of all employees.

Sentences: 親が子どもを叱しかるのは、子どもを愛しているからにほかならない。
Translate: When parents scold their children, it is only because they love them.

Sentences: 彼女が合格したのは努力の結果にほかならない。
Translate: The fact that she passed the exam was nothing but the result of hard work.

Sentences: 歴史の知識にかけては、クラスで佐藤さんにかなう人はいない。
Translate: There is no one in the class who can match Ms. Sato's knowledge of history.

Sentences: 私は足の速さにかけてはだれにも負けない自信がある。
Translate: I am confident that I am as fast as anyone in the world.

Sentences: 野球の全国大会に出場できるのは1県に1校のみだ。
Translate: Only one school per prefecture is allowed to participate in the national baseball tournament.

Sentences: 父が無事であるよう、ただ祈るのみです。
Translate: I can only pray that my father will be safe.

Sentences: 最近はペーパーテストのみではなく、面接も行う大学が増えた。
Translate: Recently, more and more universities are conducting interviews instead of just paper tests.

Sentences: あの国は気候が穏やかであるのみならず、人々も親切なので住みやすい。
Translate: The country is easy to live in, not only because of its mild climate, but also because of the kindness of its people.

Sentences: 彼は交通事故を起こし、自分の右足を失ったのみならず、相手にも大けがを負わせてしまった。
Translate: He had a traffic accident in which he not only lost his right leg but also seriously injured the other party.

Sentences: 木村教授は優れた研究者であるのみならず、立派な教育者でもある。
Translate: Professor Kimura is not only an excellent researcher, but also a great educator.

Sentences: この機械は性能が良いのみならず、操作も簡単だ。
Translate: This machine is not only good in performance but also easy to operate.

Sentences: 黒澤監督の映画は日本国内のみならず、海外でも高い評価を得ている。
Translate: Director Kurosawa's movies are highly acclaimed not only in Japan but also abroad.

Sentences: 男にせよ女にせよ、最低限の家事はできたほうがいいと思う。
Translate: Whether you are a man or a woman, I think you should be able to do at least some housework.

Sentences: 行くにしても行かないにしても、明日中に返事をしてください。
Translate: Whether you are going or not, please give me an answer by the end of tomorrow.

Sentences: 優勝は無理にしても、1回戦ぐらいは勝ちたい。
Translate: Even if I can't win, I want to at least win the first round.

Sentences: どれほど忙しかったにせよ、電話をかけるぐらいの時間はあったはずだ。
Translate: No matter how busy he was, he should have had enough time to make a phone call.

Sentences: たとえ記事の内容が事実であるにせよ、このようなプライバシーを書くのは問題だ。
Translate: Even if the article is true, writing this kind of privacy is problematic.

Sentences: 性格的には問題があるにしても、彼の優秀さを認めないわけにはいかない。
Translate: It is hard not to acknowledge his excellence, even if he has character issues.
